description: From Middle English bitimes, from bi (“by”) + time + adverbial -s. Equivalent to betime +‎ -s. Compare also betides.

entries.meaning: (dated) In good season or time; early, especially in the morning; seasonably.
examples: Smart lad to slip betimes away
From fields where glory does not stay.

entries.meaning: (archaic) In a short time, soon; quickly, forthwith.
examples: [O]ne prayed God right heartily aloud that He would send them betimes a knight that durst convoy them through this strait pass.
